messages.message:
Brian
yeah, that's true.  i think a lot of companies have gotten too big and powerful.  and what's to blame?  patent laws.

the only solution is strict government regulation and a removal of corporate money from all levels of govenment
also... punishments for "white collar" crimes
i don't think the protests will do anything

Brian
fuck regulation. beuocracy is what is making education so expensive.  students are in debt because of the 100 tiers of beurocrats the money has to go through before it reaches the schools.

history has shown, time and time again, the only thing to effect real change is violence
no, lack of regulation got us in the mess we are in... and that is pure and simple fact.
socialized countries have nearly free education... that is the model we need to go after.

Brian
maybe I am a bit of an anarchist here, but kill all corporate interests and all regulations and let everyone fight it out.
so you're a socialist?

no, that cannot work in the consolidated environment that our corporate culture has evolved in to
the government exists to protect the citizens welfare and ability to live a fulfilling life
part of that is to provide social benefit, like education and healthcare
every other developed nation has a handle on this
except for us
i am not a socialist, but government has a role to play in some markets

Brian
ok social benefit and healthcare, but what about social security? if you want to distribute the wealth it might as well just been added on to the tax rate, it's not helping anyone.
and what about stray organizations that aren't doing any good and costing the government millions like the TSA?
this is kind of a different conversation now
we need to fix our corporate tax rate... that system is a joke.

Brian
but it's all a result of shitty regulation.
the TSA is nothing in comparison to our budget for blowing up brown people

Brian
true fact.
our foreign policy is the elephant in the room

Brian
but for some reason, not one who touches political conversation has the balls to admit that maybe we need to bring it in and regroup and focus on our own problems for a bit, instead of killing brown people.
right, the elephant in the room implies don't talk about it right?

right
defense cuts and foreign aid cuts should be taking up substantial time on the national stage

Brian
but what about all of the technology that comes out of war?  oh wait, monsanto is still genetically engineering the world and NASA has no money.  fuck all

the military industrial complex is a PRIME example of how money has corrupted government
at least as bad as the "banksters"
oh shit... prime.  i need to check engadet.

Brian
nah, just because they can afford to pay for something doesn't mean it wasn't a good idea. pretty much all of computer technology came from military funding.  try government supported monopolies.  which goes back to corporations getting too large which in turn goes back to patent laws and general bad decisions.  thank got the AT&T merger got shot down.

Brian
althought since verizon is the best, the market could eventually decide they should be a monopoly.

the MIC has produced some great technology
but unfortunately it has produced an untenable global climate
and that trade off is unacceptable

Brian
but we killed Osama and we killed Sadam
we won right?

our foreign policy continues to breed terrorists that will fill their shoes
actions have consequences

Brian
I believe in educating the world, you really think we could make a difference if we spend more money on educating people to not become terrorist that it would make a difference?
if we didn't meddle in foreign governments we wouldn't have to worry

Brian
i am all for bomb em and drop em
just forget them
a great way to make even more terrorists!

Brian
kill all the people fighting each other and the UN makes us pay reperations
oh well
probably cheaper than 8 trillion in debt

or.. do nothing.
then there isn't a major problem.

Brian
well the benefit of being a superpower is we don't have to care about the consequences

it is clear that we do
the war on terror is bankrupting the country
that is the consequence
the terrorists are winning, our country is in shambles and (as i see it) there is no hope of a fix
this country is a shit hole for pretty much anything there is a metric for (among developed counties)
the one title that will make me feel like a success: expatriate
economic mobility: ha!
statups: ha!
healthcare: ha!
livable minimum wage: ha!
consumer protection: ha!
employee protection: ha!
i'm just glad i'm smart and not poor
but not everyone has the option or ability
and they shouldn't suffer because of it
otherwise, what is the point of prosperity?

Brian
hmmm.
i didn't have a problem getting a job.  coincidence?  not everyone is created equal.  that's a bullshit lie that idiots tell you to get you to stop fighting on the playground.  i don't mean to incite anger, but it isn't just coincidence.

all i heard was "I DON'T UNDERSTAND SCIENCE"
you can't be that dumb
we are all on a bell curve, sir
if you can't see that, maybe you are on the left

Brian
yeah, and how much science in the form of statistics goes in to figuring out what the livable minimum wage is?  i am sruvival of the fittest.  I am just out of college and considering buying a house.  what differentiates me from all the others?  opporunity, sure, the market is bad so the time for buying is good.

Brian
politics is the problem here.  politics isn't science.

ability, socioeconomic status, and luck
that is what differentiates you

Brian
thank you.  I am the 1%

a) not yet.
b) it wasn't a compliment

Brian
http://www.financialsamurai.com/2011/04/12/how-much-money-do-the-top-income-earners-make-percent/

you make 400k?
if you made 400k you'd have better plates

Brian
hmm, I am getting new plates.

i grew up in the top 1%

Brian
then how are you such a liberal douche? (mostly joking <3)
because i think

Brian
i g2g bed.  as usual it was an absolute pleasure debating with you.  educational as well. I hope you decide to reply to my post.

i respect conservatives about as much as i respect people who believe in god
(mostly kidding <3)

Brian
lol, fuck you
haha.  night!

Brian
goodnight sir.  i am tempted to post this whole thing to facebook.

it was fun
needs more sources though
although take out my vague reference to violent overthrow of the government
and maybe the most offensive bit of this country is shit and i don't want to live here at all

Brian
I agree.  I am not incredibly proud to be an American.  and I am guilty of political apathy too.

Brian
So here is some new information against regulation.  If you follow the logical path back from why rich people are so rich.  Bankers are making tons of money and control a lot of the countries money and where it goes.  We had to bail them out because so people who couldn't afford houses defaulted.  But even before that, why would they be loaning to people in the first place?  The Dod Frank act told them to give poor people money for a house.  A prime example of too much government regulation and 1 group of people making a stupid decision causes huge damage to our economy.

If that is your honest understanding of the housing financial crisis you don't understand it at all.
The problem came when these toxic assets were hidden in mortgage backed securities.
They were ingenious in hiding known toxic assets behind a AAA rating and no way to determine the actual value
It was fraud to the highest order... And instead of a bailout going to homeowners to restore value, it went to the banks who foreclosed with reckless abandon

Brian
Hmm good information.  Thanks.

But I need to look into how people were pushed into homes they couldn't afford
I don't know enough about that

Brian
yeah, it did happen.  I need to read about the toxic assets
did you see this?  https://www.facebook.com/event.php?eid=281139538577206

Brian
!
hola friend

Brian
hola!
i haven't done any reading on the housing crisis since we talked.... and i feel lazy.

Brian
hahaha
i just had an awesome first date with someone i met on okcupid.  i did not expect that.

Brian
oh cool
being a nice person and describing yourself as a nice person are two very different things

Brian
I think a lot of people do either and both
so who are you and jessie to tell them that they aren't
?

i have no idea
i do not know anything about the situation
i just hate guys using the descriptor "nice guys"
so hard

Brian
my first reply was simply pointing out the fact that Jessie is one of those girls that complain about guys coming on to her and sends a whole mess of signals, and when a guy comes on to strong, she finally tells them that she is in a relationship
when if she had any tact at all she would find a way to pursue the shared interests, AND let them know that she has a boyfriend.
perhaps true, i don't know her well enough to judge that

Brian
I recently ran in to this, I met a nice bar tender, I expressed a shared interest, she let me know that she had a boyfriend and then we never hung out
i stop hanging out with girls when i find out they aren't interested

Brian
not quite the same.

if i like them romantically
maybe she doesn't set boundaries well?  i don't actually know her

Brian
she also has no concept of time frame, can't you like someone and hang out and then determine if you could have romantic feelings?  why is it that you would choose to hang out with someone you are romantically interested in over someone you have more in common with but is not single?

Brian
ah well
i'm going to bed
i'm going to make some videos where i don't look creepy

Brian
sounds fun!
gn

Brian
Oh man, internet at 30,000 ft is pretty hot.
How was your week?
hey, i have a simple code question for you

Brian
whats up?

i tried to fix an issue  in ubercart with a patch, but i was told my logic wouldn't work... but I don't see the problem.  im sure it is something simple that i'm just missing.
http://drupal.org/files/uc_usps-address_zone_validation-14.patch
the zone field is only valid for country 840, so i don't want it checked otherwise

Brian
so if you have if (empty($destination->country) and then under it you have if($destination->country == 840 that will never be reached
so what you need to do is this:
+  if ( empty($destination->zone) || 
+       empty($destination->postal_code) || 
+       (empty($destination->country) || $destination->country == 840)) { 
+     // Skip this shipping method. 
     return array(); 
   }
see what i did?  remove your change and put it down next to empty($destination->country) and change it to an || symbol not &&
basically, you are saying if country is empty or if country is not empty and county equals 840 then return array()
which I assume blanks out that control you are talking about
the zone should only be checked if the country is 840

Brian
I would have to look at more of the module
the rest should be checked for all countries.

Brian
what version is this for?

here is how i thought the logic went
(if the zone is empty and the country is 840) or the postal code is empty or the country is empty

Brian
yes but what does return array() mean?
how is it used?

that I don't know
i know my changes to the code fixed the problem i was having

Brian
huh
yeah I don't know
post your working example to the drupal bug report section
*to the patch thread
i did

Brian
oh

"That won't work - if zone is empty your code doesn't even check the country ... You want to check the country first, and only if the country is US should you check the other fields."
is what I was told.  i just didn't see where i went wrong.
i mean, all i did was change this: if (empty($destination->zone)        ||
to: if ( (empty($destination->zone) && $destination->country == 840) ||

Brian
I can see that
Yeah I don't see it

does that not prevent the empty from firing unless the country is 840?
should I just swap the statements?

Brian
I am having trouble understanding when you want that to pass, does return array() mean it skips checking the "zone field"?

http://pastebin.com/pNvGG0hf
that is the whole function

Brian
I don't think that function does what you think it does

hrm, okay
I just wish the package maintainer had replied in a way that I could make sense of it.
especially given that my patch fixed  my problem

Brian
just tell him you aren't a programmer and explain the problem you are trying to fix with hiding that field and they will help
alright.  thanks for your help

we should party in phoenix sometime.

Fairly annoying

yeah
how's life, man?  I haven't talked to you in forever

Brian
Its pretty excellent.
My boss left, and good riddance, he was an awful developer.  I got a raise.  Married life is great.  I am getting new trees delivered tomorrow.  I like having a house and finding projects to work on.  I expanded the garden in the back yard and am planning to build a green house.

I'm sad the house I tried to buy fell through
I really want those projects
It had a 4 car garage, I was so excited

Yeah, congrats on the wife.  And the job getting easier.
I've gotten several raises over here and about 1.5 years ago finally got the contractor that had been doing server admin stuff out of here
That guy was a little crazy.  Thanks to him we have a 13k dell server for 15 clients.  8 600GB SAS drives in the thing -  in no way do we need that, lol.

Brian
nice
now if only I could get a raise to his level, when he was working longer hours towards the end he was making 45/hr
